message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with the problem of reconstructing the shape and motion of humans from RGB-D data, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR). The proposed method involves using eigen-texturing and eigen-deformation to represent the texture and deformation of a partially observed non-rigid 3D human, which is a technique that could be relevant to multimedia (cs.MM) and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of neural-network-based coefficient regression, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
